name: James WINNING, III and Hilda Winning, his wife, and Brent Winning v. AETNA CASUALTY & SURETY COMPANY, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Winning v. Aetna Casualty & Surety Co.

parties: James WINNING, III and Hilda Winning, his wife, and Brent Winning v. AETNA CASUALTY & SURETY COMPANY, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
MONTEMURO, J., is sitting by designation.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Timothy J. Burdette and Bryan J. Smith, Pittsburgh, for Aetna.
William M. Radcliffe, Uniontown, for Winning.
casebody.head_matter:
664 A.2d 1352
James WINNING, III and Hilda Winning, his wife, and Brent Winning v. AETNA CASUALTY & SURETY COMPANY, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Sept. 19, 1995.
Decided Oct. 11, 1995.
Timothy J. Burdette and Bryan J. Smith, Pittsburgh, for Aetna.
William M. Radcliffe, Uniontown, for Winning.
Before NIX, C.J., and FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE and MONTEMURO, JJ.
